description.narrative: The project aims to support Ethnic Minority Women Economic Empowerment through application of Industry 4.0 technology

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Project Output 1: EM women producer groups connected with their value chain partners and provided with market information and tailor-made support, established and/or expanded their business with higher income Activity result 1.1: Value-chain assessment and identification of potential partners for EM women's business, with possible 4.0 sollutions and application. Activity Result 1.2: EM women producer groups in Bac Kan and Dak Nong established and/or expanded their viable and sustainable businesses, got better access to market/market information, disaster prevention and mitigation via introduction of a multi-stakeholder platform and innovative 4.0 solutions. 1.1.1 Existence of value chain assessment and identification of potential partners for EM business in Bac Kan province. 1.1.2 Existence of value chain assessment and identification of potential partners for EM business in Dak Nong province. 1.2.1 Number of EM women groups empowered and supported to develop/upgrade their business plans. 1.2.2 Number of EM women groups got access to formal financial credit or support from NTP-SPR/NTP-NRD. 1.2.3 Number of EM women groups equipped with new skills and knowledge. 1.2.4 Number of EM women groups expanded/improved their business with support/cooperation from new value chain partners. 1.2.5 Number of EM women groups increased their income. 1.2.6 Availability of an innovative 4.0 solution (applied) in Bac Kan and Dak Nong province. 1.2.7 Number of EM women groups have better access to markets, market information, disaster prevention and mitigation. Project Output 2: Replication of multi-stakeholder platforms in other 3 -4 provinces Activity Result 2.1: Good practices in Bac Kan and Dak Nong documented and shared with other localities and central government agencies for scaling up and policies/ regulations revision. 2.1.1 Number of good practices documented and shared with relevant partners (central/local) 2.1.2 Number of provinces using the platform developed by the pr

comment.narrative: Project Output 1: EM women producer groups connected with their value chain partners and provided with market information and tailor-made support, established and/or expanded their business with higher income Activity result 1.1: Value-chain assessment and identification of potential partners for EM women's business, with possible 4.0 sollutions and application. Activity Result 1.2: EM women producer groups in Bac Kan and Dak Nong established and/or expanded their viable and sustainable businesses, got better access to market/market information, disaster prevention and mitigation via introduction of a multi-stakeholder platform and innovative 4.0 solutions. 1.1.1 Non existence of value chain assessment and identification of potential partners for EM business in Bac Kan province. 1.1.2 Non existence of value chain assessment and identification of potential partners for EM business in Dak Nong province. 1.2.1 Number of EM women groups empowered and supported to develop/upgrade their business plans: 0 1.2.2 Number of EM women groups got access to formal financial credit or support from NTP-SPR/NTP-NRD: 0 1.2.3 Number of EM women groups equipped with new skills and knowledge: 0 1.2.4 Number of EM women groups expanded/improved their business with support/cooperation from new value chain partners: 0 1.2.5 Number of EM women groups increased their income: 0 1.2.6 Non-existence of an innovative 4.0 solution (applied) in Bac Kan and Dak Nong province: 0 1.2.7 Number of EM women groups have better access to markets, market information, disaster prevention and mitigation: 0 Project Output 2: Replication of multi-stakeholder platforms in other 3 -4 provinces Activity Result 2.1: Good practices in Bac Kan and Dak Nong documented and shared with other localities and central government agencies for scaling up and policies/ regulations revision. 2.1.1 Number of good practices documented and shared with relevant partners (central/local): 0 2.1.2 Number of provinces using the pl

1.1.1: Existence of value chain assessment and identification of potential partners for EM business in Bac Kan province. 1.1.2: Existence of value chain assessment and identification of potential partners for EM business in Dak Nong province. 1.2.1: 60 (EM women groups) 1.2.2: 10 (EM women groups) 1.2.3: 10 (EM women groups). 1.2.4: 30 (EM women groups). 1.2.5: 50 (EM women groups). 1.2.6 Availability of an innovative 4.0 solution (applied) in Bac Kan and Dak Nong province. 1.2.7: 20 (EM women groups) 2.1.1: 6 (EM women groups) 2.1.2: 3 (EM women groups) 2.1.3: 30 (EM women groups)

1.1.1: Existence and operational of value chain assessment and identification of potential partners for EM business in Bac Kan province. 1.1.2: Existence and operational of value chain assessment and identification of potential partners for EM business in Dak Nong province. 1.2.1: 62 EM women groups empowered and supported to develop/upgrade their business plans. 1.2.2: 12 EM women groups got access to formal financial credit or support from NTP-SPR/NTP-NRD 1.2.3: 10 (EM women groups). 1.2.4: 30 (EM women groups). 1.2.5: 49 (EM women groups/cooperatives). 1.2.6 Availability of an innovative 4.0 solution (applied) in Bac Kan and Dak Nong province. 1.2.7: 49 (EM women groups) have better access to markets, market information, disaster prevention and mitigation. Project Output 2: Replication of multi-stakeholder platforms in other 3 -4 provinces 2.1.1: 8 good practices documented and shared with relevant partners (central/local) 2.1.2: 4 Provinces using the platform developed by the project for supporting their EM women groups in agricultural production and livelihoods 2.1.3: 46 (EM women groups, 26 groups in Bak Kan, 20 groups in Dak Nong); making the total of 679 EM people are directly benefiting (via improved income and knowledge); 2,636 people (1,546 in Bak Kan; 1,090 one in Dak Nong) are indirectly benefiting from the project (via supplying goods/services for the 46 cooperatives/groups Availability of a set of recommendations from assessment of the National Targeted Program on Sustainable Poverty Reduction (2019 -2020) and best practices, lessons learned from Bak Kan and Dak Nong which are key technical inputs for Government of Vietnam to design and replicate this approach in the next policies and programs on poverty reduction and social economic development in ethnic minority and mountainous areas.
The project is operationally closed. No activity in 2020. No targets for 2020.
The project is operationally closed. No activity in 2020. No results for 2020.
The project is operationally closed. No activity in 2021. No targets for 2021.
The project is operationally closed. No activity in 2021. No results for 2021.
